dialogue: You get the impression it’s been furnished with stuff from the garbage.
Not everything… And it takes talent to pick furniture out of the garbage.
You still haven’t finished moving in. Do you want a hand?
No… I’ll do it… after.
And, even so, you’re going with Martha?
She is totally alone in this, Damian, none of her friends are supporting her with
In the years I was with her, she never told me she had a daughter.
It’s a very sad story, a terrible misunderstanding.
Have you told her we’re in touch?
No. We’ve talked about you… in a general sort of way. She has fond memories of you.

Really? I’m glad. Our relationship was mostly physical. She was always about to go off somewhere else, that’s why our lovemaking had that sense of urgency. It was like having sex with a terrorist, it always felt like the last time.
She rates you pretty highly as a lover.
I’d like to know what rating you give me… They take their drinks and sit in the dining room, on a large couch that had a previous life, but it is still pretty and special.
Damian, I can’t believe you’re still flirting with me.
I’m serious.
No, you’re not serious. What’s really serious here is Martha’s situation.
And your being terrified of death? You’ve just published a book about that. Have you overcome that thanks to the book?
Hi, how are you?
Oh, I’m going to be giving a lecture near Woodstock, at Bard, in two weeks. Maybe we can see each other…
I don’t think that’s a good idea. I’ll be with Martha the whole time… I’ll call you if I can.
You’re going to need a lawyer.
Yes… I should look for one.
Let me take care of that. But I’ll have to fill them in.
No. In that case, no. This is an absolute secret. She doesn’t even know I’ve told you.
Okay, but if there’s anything you need, just let me know. I worry about you.
Thank you.
Well, you’ll have to practice.
Lying?
Yes. Officially you aren’t aware of Martha’s intentions.
Yeah.
You should write a kind of script for yourself and stick to it. I could help you. And I’ve found a lawyer, in case you need one.
Thank you. Let’s not talk about it now. How did your lecture go?

Well, they weren’t too happy about my not taking questions. In the end, people started muttering, and someone called me a coward. But it doesn’t bother me, I’ve spent way too much time caring about my reputation, and for what?
So what are you doing with all that time you’ve gotten back? Are you doing more of what you like?
I must admit that my interest in things has been shrinking as I get older.
Martha said the same thing a couple days ago… there are so few things left that she can really enjoy.
I understand her.
Yeah, but you’re not sick.
No, but I feel the same way, especially after the pandemic. I don’t go to the cinema, or listen to music… I read a lot, but only subjects to do with my lectures…
Don't you go to galleries? You used to love that. When we were together we'd talk about the power of art. Are you interested in that at least?
Even if every poet in the world sat down to write a poem about the climate crisis, it wouldn’t save one tree.
Well, at least you’re interested in the trees…
I’m interested in sex too.
Then you’re not so bad.
Yes, I am. I think a lot about sex, but I don’t have it as much as I’d like. When I was young, if a day went by without sex, I thought it was incomplete…
Yes, I remember that…
I’m not nostalgic, but I miss the nights when we’d drink, take drugs and have sex, and all that didn’t distract us from what we really wanted to do…
You drank and you took drugs. Well, more than I did anyway.

I don’t know how much you drank but you always acted like you were as blitzed as the rest of us, but you were always an essential part of the party. That is, until you got bored and went off to discover Europe. Do you want us to talk about that?
No…. Tell me about your lecture.

I admit that I’ve become something of a monomaniac… My own son is barely speaking to me because I didn’t hide how appalled I was that his wife was expecting another child. He doesn’t want me anywhere near her for fear she’ll have a miscarriage.
How could you tell him that they shouldn’t have another child!
It’s their third!
Well, so what would the next logical step

People should be aware, once and for all, of the state of the fucking planet they’re living on! … Perhaps this isn’t the best subject for you. You’re living with a dying woman, in a world that also agonizes.
You really think the situation’s that desperate?

Yes. Yes, I do. Read the science and then see what the world is doing with it… They’re releasing more CO2 into the air than ever before. Sooner or later, and I fear it will be sooner, one day all this will be shot to hell. And nothing’s going to hasten the end of the planet more than the survival of neo-liberalism and the rise of the far right. And we have both of them here, marching side by side… I’m sorry, I didn’t want to bring you down, but I get riled up with all this.
You cannot go around saying there’s no hope.
It’s tragic and I guess it’s very

I’m living expecting to find Martha’s body in her bed any day. But that doesn’t stop me from enjoying every minute with her, just the opposite. I’m learning that from her and you should too… There are lots of ways to live inside of tragedy. Of course it’s painful, it’s very painful but I've accepted it. I’m living each moment with the same joy she does, and with the same appreciation. The last thing I need is to hear a speech like yours.
I’ve always admired you for that…
What?
You’re one of the only people who knows how to suffer without making others feel guilty about it.
Do you think it will be much longer?
No, it’ll be soon. Any day now…
You have to be prepared. I know the police. They’ll ask you all sorts of questions, they’ll dig in your relationship like scavengers. You need a kind of mental script.
I do have one. I’ve thought about it.
Stick to it, and keep repeating the same
And when it happens, you should call the police before you call me.
I need to call her daughter. I should call her before I call you.
All right, but be careful what you say to her. I had to tell the lawyer about the situation.
Why do we have to go through all this, like we were criminals? Shouldn’t dying people have the right to end their lives with dignity?!
They will, once our teetering health system completely collapses.
Martha…?
He treated me like I was the killer.
But you were with me!
He doesn’t care… He insists that I’m implicated. He spoke to a friend of Martha’s, Stella Byrne, who had refused to help her…
Thank you, Sarah.
I can’t believe that Stella
He probably cornered her. And they have Martha’s computer, and her cell phone. Do you know if they talked?
Not that I know, she didn’t tell me anything.
What do you want to do?
I need to go back to the house. I still have to pack up Martha’s things.
Yes, speaking. It’s Michelle…
Martha’s daughter.
Yes… Of course you can come… I’m headed there now… I’ll text you the address… See you soon.
Well, I’m headed back to the city… Let me know when you’re back and I’ll help you with your move.
Thank you for everything. I’ll call you.
